DataElement.preferredName: Hospital Organ Failure Discharge Diagnosis Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field to identify the organ that failed that was an identified reason for hospitalization at the time of discharge, the end point of an inpatient hospital contact which consists of one or several days of care.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to organ failure, loss of the ability to function in a part of the body that performs a specific function, as an identified reason for hospitalization at the time of discharge, the end point of an inpatient hospital contact which consists of one or several days of care.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.

Concepts.definition: An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.

Property.preferredDefinition: A part of the body that performs a specific function.  For example, the heart is an organ.:loss of ability to function normally.:In healthcare, discharge represents the end point of an inpatient hospital contact which consists of one or several days of care. (from Wikipedia):The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.
A lack of occurrence or performance.
The release of a patient from a course of care.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the specified free-text field related to an aspect of patient/participant's diagnosis

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
